ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Bard Carpal Tunnel
ygData.msgSnippet: The mouse is in one hand, the controller in the other.  You re right about mapping the buttons.  I ll try to get around to messing with it more this
ygData.messageBody:
The mouse is in one hand, the controller in the other. You're right about
mapping the buttons. I'll try to get around to messing with it more this
weekend...it's sat there doing nothing long enough. :)

I'll post a (my opinion only) review on it, if there's anyone interested.

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: KAZ [mailto:kazvorpal@...]
Sent: Friday, February 08, 2002 11:10 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Bard Carpal Tunnel


--- Christopher Sanders <christopher.sanders@...> wrote:
> I got a Nostromo n50 for Xmas. I haven't messed with it a whole let yet,
> as
> I've been busier with a machine that likes to crash...but, while it's
still
> a lot of button pressing, it will be on a controller that adjusts somewhat
> to your hand.
>
> With a couple other functions on there as well, will be a nice controller.
> :) Might be worth a look, if you get a chance.

You're saying buy a one of those gamepad-type controllers to play EQ? I am
guessing you map all but buttons to the keyboard...but what about the
mouse-only stuff?
